comment: Asgill's the worst teacher in the ECET department. Tons of HW for every class that he never looks at and grades off participation. Doesnt update his syllabus we got 1/4 through the semester before he told us WE had the wrong book. Nonsense tests that everyone gets 40 on. I could go on worst weve been cursed with for 4 years of ECET, get used to him
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: If you take Professor Asgill be prepared to teach yourself through the textbook. Never works out problems on the board, it was him showing you a worked example from the text book on the board and just talking about it. Most of the time sat in lab with headphones in or just not there and when you ask him for help, he is not helpful at all.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Gives a lot of work due within a week, which makes students complain, therefore then he would change the deadline, hence deadlines became a mess. Record the deadlines posted of assignments in case he wants to penalize you for: -Something being late -Gives an extension on an assignment that you that you already turned in and only has one submission

Confusing Deadlines. Lectures are power point slides making attendance a chore. Broad test reviews for broad tests and quizzes. Majority of grades come from exams and quizzes. Grade recovered via online exams and whatever curve he must of provided. IT and EE also offer this class, take it with one of them instead, the lecture will transfer to EET.

Prepare to teach yourself. Going to class was pretty much pointless. He assigned lots of homework, but if the class spoke to him as a whole he would move the due date. This was the case several times. Exams were difficult. He uploaded practice exam before the exam. Questions were similar in some aspects, but don't expect the same questions on exam.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Asgill is really laid back, and teaches a pretty easy class. His communication skills are poor, and he leaves his students to teach themselves the material, but in an introductory class, nothing can't be found with a quick google search. If this class was hard for you, change your major.
He is not clear at all, in his class you pretty much have to teach yourself.
worst class i have ever had. i would change majors before i took another one of his classes. He would not help with homework questions, he tested us on material he never covered.
Not that great a teacher, but I aced(100%) the class.  So he must have taught me something.
Not a good professor. Teaches straight out of the book, few examples if any. Assigns a huge amount of homework with very little time to complete it.

a very horrible professor.  overall grade is based upon 2 test a final, and about 8 homework assignments.  he offers no help in lab, however the lab assistants make up for it.  i made a D in his class.
does not give examples in class on how to do things, but will help you if you go to him during office hours. never in lab.

This guy is the worst teacher I have ever had. Truthfully speaking, He opens the lab, he then leaves. Whle other professors will explain the situation(same class)--he wont. He expects you to figure everything out yourself. He leaves u in the dark!

Dr. Asgill is a nice guy, but he can't or won't teach.  He expects students to learn the material on their own, and if you have any questions, you can ask him.  Why am I paying tuition for this type of education when I could have just bought the book?
